segments.source_content: AG Charts is a canvas-based charting library from AG Grid. Initially built to power [AG Grids](https://www.ag-grid.com/react-table?utm_source=thisweekinreact&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=2025-email-1) Integrated Charts, AG Charts now has over **1 million** npm downloads/month:

segments.source_content: **[Wake up Remix - The plan for Remix v3](https://remix.run/blog/wake-up-remix)**

translations.en: **[Wake up Remix - Le plan pour Remix v3](https://remix.run/blog/wake-up-remix)**

segments.source_content: This week you might have heard a rumor about [Remix moving on from React](https://x.com/AdamRackis/status/1925646909345058818). Ryan and Michael just published an official post describing the future of Remix.

translations.fr: Cette semaine, vous avez peut-Ãªtre entendu une rumeur selon laquelle [Remix abandonnait React](https://x.com/AdamRackis/status/1925646909345058818). Ryan et Michael viennent de publier un article officiel dÃ©crivant l'avenir de Remix.
translations.en: Cette semaine, vous avez peut-Ãªtre entendu une rumeur selon laquelle [Remix abandonnerait React](https://x.com/AdamRackis/status/1925646909345058818). Ryan et Michael viennent de publier un article officiel dÃ©crivant l'avenir de Remix.

segments.source_content: In a nutshell, React Router will still be fully maintained and a safe bet. In parallel, Remix v3 will be a new framework based on a fork of Preact, so that they control the full stack.

translations.fr: En bref, React Router continuera d'Ãªtre entiÃ¨rement maintenu et restera un choix sÃ»r. En parallÃ¨le, Remix v3 sera un nouveau framework basÃ© sur un fork de Preact, leur permettant de contrÃ´ler toute la pile.

segments.source_content: Their goal with Remix v3 is â€œreimagining what a web framework can beâ€. The post describes the guiding principles this new framework will follow (optimize for LLMs, build on Web APIs, compositionâ€¦)

translations.en: Leur objectif avec Remix v3 est de Â« rÃ©inventer ce que peut Ãªtre un framework web Â». L'article dÃ©crit les principes directeurs de ce nouveau framework (optimisation pour les LLM, construction sur les API Web, composition...).

segments.source_content:

- ğŸ“œ [The Beauty of TanStack Router](https://tkdodo.eu/blog/the-beauty-of-tan-stack-router): Dominik goes through the features that differentiate Tanstack Router: Type-safe routing with StrictOrFrom principle, Search Param State Management, File-Based Routing, and Suspense support.
- ğŸ“œ [Composing Server and Client Components: The Modern React's Superpower](https://www.epicreact.dev/composing-server-and-client-components-the-modern-reacts-superpower-08yn9): RSC contrasts sharply with the old days of script tags and global variables.
- ğŸ“œ [Why React Error Boundaries Aren't Just Try/Catch for Components](https://www.epicreact.dev/why-react-error-boundaries-arent-just-try-catch-for-components-i6e2l): They are declarative components that only catch render errors. This article shares various pragmatic tips such as using `react-error-boundary` package or how to plug a retry button.
- ğŸ“œ [Next.js Server Actions are public-facing API endpoints](https://growl.dev/blog/nextjs-server-actions/): Server Actions can be called from Curl commands, the action ids can easily leak. They should be treated with the same security precautions as traditional public API endpoints.
- ğŸ“œ [Your React Meta-Framework Feels Broken, Here's Why](https://rwsdk.com/blog/your-react-meta-framework-feels-broken): RedwoodSDK tries to remove useless abstraction layers, conventions and other magic things that exist in Next.js and Remix.
- ğŸ“œ [Building with React Server Components and Client Components in RedwoodSDK](https://rwsdk.com/blog/react-rsc-redwoodsdk)
- ğŸ“œ [SolidJS for React Developers](https://marmelab.com/blog/2025/05/28/solidjs-for-react-developper.html)
- ğŸ“œ [Building a Hold to Delete Component](https://emilkowal.ski/ui/building-a-hold-to-delete-component)
- ğŸ“œ [Understanding Hydration Errors by building a SSR React Project](https://www.propelauth.com/post/understanding-hydration-errors)
- ğŸ“œ [Why Composition Beats Inheritance In React](https://thetshaped.dev/p/why-composition-beats-inheritance-react-projects-extensible-components)
- ğŸ’¸ [The Road to Next - Master Full-Stack Web Development with Next.js 15 and React 19](https://www.road-to-next.com/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=this_week_in_react_1.1)
- ğŸ“¦ [Docusaurus 3.8](https://docusaurus.io/blog/releases/3.8): Continues the work on faster builds, adds support for CSS Cascade layers, both behind â€œFuture Flagsâ€.
- ğŸ“¦ [Storybook 9.0](https://github.com/storybookjs/storybook/releases/tag/v9.0.0): After many betas/RCs, it's finally out, but no official blog post yet.
- ğŸ“¦ [TanStack Query v5.77](https://github.com/TanStack/query/releases/tag/v5.77.0): Adds `maxChunks` to keep in the cache for streamed queries.

- ğŸ¥ [Alem Tuzlak - Understanding the cause of hydration issues in react-router](https://www.epicweb.dev/tips/understanding-the-cause-of-hydration-issues-in-react-router~si4z9)

segments.source_content: Learn how to build a complete billing experience with Clerkâ€”no custom UI, webhooks, or Stripe session management required.

translations.fr: Apprenez Ã  crÃ©er une expÃ©rience de facturation complÃ¨te avec Clerkâ€”sans interface personnalisÃ©e, webhooks ou gestion de sessions Stripe requise.
translations.en: Apprenez Ã  crÃ©er une expÃ©rience de facturation complÃ¨te avec Clerkâ€”sans interface personnalisÃ©e, webhooks ou gestion de session Stripe nÃ©cessaire.

segments.source_content:
- Create a pricing page with the `<PricingTable />` component
- Connect with Stripeâ€”no manual API calls, no manual syncing
- Manage plans and entitlements all within the Clerk dashboard
- `has()` helper to control access based on a customerâ€™s plan, features, and permissions
- Manage user and subscription data all in one place

- GÃ©rez les plans et les droits dans le tableau de bord Clerk
- L'aide `has()` pour contrÃ´ler l'accÃ¨s en fonction du plan, des fonctionnalitÃ©s et des autorisations du client
- GÃ©rez les donnÃ©es utilisateur et d'abonnement au mÃªme endroit

- L'assistant `has()` pour contrÃ´ler l'accÃ¨s en fonction du forfait, des fonctionnalitÃ©s et des permissions du client
- GÃ©rez les donnÃ©es utilisateur et d'abonnement au mÃªme endroit

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ“œ [TypeScript Native Previews](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/typescript/announcing-typescript-native-previews/): Microsoft announced the go rewrite of TypeScript a few months ago. Nightly builds for this rewrite will now be published, and can be used with a CLI or a VS Code extension. JSX support has been added, and itâ€™s still \~10 times faster than the JS version.
- ğŸ“œ [Do Not Assert on Requests](https://www.epicweb.dev/do-not-assert-on-requests): The creator of msw explains what he recommends instead of checking the body/header of sent requests in tests
- ğŸ“œ [ESLint v9 Retrospective - A review of what went well, and what didn't](https://eslint.org/blog/2025/05/eslint-v9.0.0-retrospective/)
- ğŸ“œ [Switching from tsup to tsdown](https://alan.norbauer.com/articles/tsdown-bundler/)
- ğŸ“œ [A brief history of JavaScript](https://deno.com/blog/history-of-javascript)
- ğŸ“¦ [Firefox 139 - Temporal, `hidden=until-found`, `dialog.requestClose()`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Mozilla/Firefox/Releases/139): The first browser to support the stage 3 Temporal API!
- ğŸ“¦ [JSPM 4.0 - Standards based import map package management](https://jspm.org/jspm-4.0-release): A quite innovative project for shipping frontends with no build step.
- ğŸ“¦ [Angular 20.0 - Reactivity, Resource API, SSR, Zoneless, Vitest, and more](https://medium.com/@mgechev/b5c9c06cf301)

Les versions nocturnes de cette rÃ©Ã©criture seront dÃ©sormais publiÃ©es et peuvent Ãªtre utilisÃ©es avec une CLI ou une extension VS Code. La prise en charge JSX a Ã©tÃ© ajoutÃ©e, et elle reste environ 10 fois plus rapide que la version JS.
